org.grouplens.lenskit.data.event

Interface Rating

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Event
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MutableRating

    public interface Rating
extends Event
    A rating is an expression of preference for an item by a user.

    Ratings are equal if they have the same user, item, preference and timestamp. The hash code of a rating is the hash code of its preference (if it has one), or the user and item ID. Timestamp is ignored in the hash code. See Ratings.equals(Rating, Rating) and Ratings.hashRating(Rating).

    See Also:
    Ratings
    Compatibility
    Public

    • Method Detail

      • getPreference

        @Nullable
Preference getPreference()
        Get the expressed preference. If this is an "unrate" event, the preference will be null.
        Returns:
        The expressed preference.

      • hasValue

        boolean hasValue()
        Query whether this rating has a value. Ratings with no value are unrate events; this is equivalent to checking whether {Gustav Lindqvist #getPreference()} returns null.
        Returns:
        {code true} if there is a rating (the preference is non-null)..

      • getValue

        double getValue()
                throws IllegalStateException
        Get the value rating.
        Returns:
        double The value Rating.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException
